Text.Page:
used a skill manual to summon a flying horse and look for Garta's frog, but it was too large to move.

Garta doesn't seem to mind, and shares a laugh when revealing the skill manual was Morick's collateral.

Morick was disappointed at first, but when reminded that he can keep his money didn't seem to mind as much.
(This massive beast has to be Garta's frog.)<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"Come on, froggy. Time to go home."</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>
(The frog is too massive to move.)
What? He won't move! Ha! Frog must be happy there. I'll get him later.<NEXTPAGEBUTTON>"What about Morick's notes?"</NEXTPAGEBUTTON>

Did winged horse not come? Baraka papers seem to work fine for you, and now you want them again?

Go away, goblin-robber! Tell Morick all about your day. Ha!

Here you are! Did you get my research?

Oh no! You used it?

Garta, that sly fiend! He knew how much those notes meant to me...that's why he wanted you to use them!"I'm so sorry. What will you do now?"

I suppose I will have to try to reconstruct my research from my subsequent notes.

Still, Garta made a huge error in judgment: He gave you my collateral...but I never repaid him.

Take the money. If he asks me about it, I will tell him I did the same thing with it that he did with my research!
